result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan P. Pizur was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ryan P. Pizur is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ryan P. Pizur was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 1 day served if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*  Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan P. Pizur

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Douglas Henderson. Count 2 - Dismissed on State motion.  Count 1 - Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Sentence withheld, placed on probation for 2 years w/conditons.  Credit for 1 day served if probation is revoked.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Douglas Henderson.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Def. did not submit to a competency evaluation.  Atty Henderson believes an evaluation is no longer necessary.  Atty Henderson received a plea offer from ADA Binger today and requests time to discuss it with def.  Status conf. 12/10/15 at 9:00.  Bond continued.
